Subject: Ant batchtest vs Test suite for prioritization

Dear all,
I find myself faced with the following issue. I've been assigned =
to
a new project where I have a group of Junit test classes (around 
150). =
My aim is to setup a fully automated test environment 
starting on the curr=
ent project status. I was thinking of using 
Ant as the the first step, and=
 then moving to some continuous
integration tool further down the line.

I =
see two main outstanding problems:

1) My test hierarchy is made up of a he=
terogeneous set of classes,
some of which are purely stand-alone classes (i=
.e. I have to 
manually launch them), while some others are grouped into
te=
st suites. 

2) Test case complexity is very wide, ranging from very simple=
 
(and fast) ones to more complicated ones than can take hours to
complete.=


So I was wondering what is the best tradeoff between prioritizing
tests a=
t code level (i.e. with Test Suites) vs. at script level
(i.e. by specifyin=
g the desired order in an Ant batchtest task).

Any help on this issue will=
 be greatly appreciated.

Best regards
Emmanuele Sordini
